title: Antiqua
content:
In the German language, all [serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20120826035714/http:/typophile.com/wiki/serif) faces are generally referred to as Antiquas.

In the early 20th Century, there were three kinds of type widely available throughout German-speaking countries: [Blackletter](http://web.archive.org/web/20120826035714/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Blackletter), [Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20120826035714/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Grotesk), and [Antiqua](http://web.archive.org/web/20120826035714/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Antiqua).
author: dan_reynolds
